line.text: O how thy worth with manners may I sing
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: When thou art all the better part of me
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: What can mine own praise to mine own self bring
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: And what ist but mine own when I praise thee
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Even for this let us divided live
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: And our dear love lose name of single one
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: That by this separation I may give
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: That due to thee which thou deserv alone
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: O absence what a torment wouldst thou prove
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Were it not thy sour leisure gave sweet leave
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: To entertain the time with thoughts of love
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Which time and thoughts so sweetly doth deceive
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: And that thou teachest how to make one twain
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: By praising him here who doth hence remain
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*
